stance_1: I eat all kinds of meat
stance_2: I sometimes feel self-conscious about eating fatty meat
justification: Eating all kinds of meat, including fatty meats, conflicts with feeling self-conscious about eating fatty meat.

stance_1: I eat all kinds of meat
stance_2: People I eat with choose less fatty meats
justification: The interviewee eats all kinds of meat, while their social contacts choose less fatty meats, indicating a conflicting approach.

stance_1: I eat all kinds of meat
justification: Social contacts watch their weight and thus choose less fatty meats, while the interviewee eats all kinds regardless of fat content.

stance_1: I eat all kinds of meat
stance_2: I sometimes prefer dishes without meat
justification: Eating all kinds of meat is somewhat in conflict with sometimes preferring dishes without meat.

stance_2: I think meat gives me energy
justification: The interviewee states they eat meat at dinner because they believe it gives them energy.

stance_2: I think meat is a good source of protein
justification: The interviewee is motivated to eat meat at dinner because they think it is a good source of protein.

stance_1: I sometimes feel self-conscious about eating fatty meat
stance_2: People I eat with choose less fatty meats
justification: The interviewee feels self-conscious about eating fatty meat because others choose less fatty meats.

stance_1: People I eat with choose less fatty meats
justification: Social contacts choose less fatty meats specifically because they watch their weight.
